account_takeover.name: AccountTakeover
account_takeover.description: Labs focused on exploiting account takeover vulnerabilities.

BruteForce.description: In this lab, your challenge is to take over the admin@iha089.org account by identifying and exploiting vulnerabilities in the authentication mechanism through brute force techniques.

ImproperAccessControl.description: This lab has a Host Header Injection vulnerability in its password reset mechanism. Exploit it to intercept the reset token and take over the account.

ATO_via_XSS.description: The XSSATO Lab login page is vulnerable to XSS, allowing attackers to inject scripts to steal users' usernames and passwords.

ATO_via_CORS.description: The corsATO Lab has a CORS vulnerability, allowing attackers to steal sensitive data from other origins.

ATO_via_IDOR.description: The IDORATO Lab's Forgot Password page is vulnerable to IDOR (Insecure Direct Object Reference).

API_Abuse.name: APIAbuse
API_Abuse.description: Labs focused on exploiting API Abuse vulnerabilities.

RateLimit.description: The Rate Limit Lab's have rate limit on login via password exploit it to gain other user accout.

MassUserEnumeration.description: The Mass User Enumeration Lab's have an vulnerability to enumerate multiple users information(email).

Open_Redirection.name: OpenRedirection
Open_Redirection.description: Labs focused on exploiting open redirection vulnerabilities.

BasicURLParameterRedirection.description: an open redirection is present on /login route exploit it to redirect user on any website.

PathBasedOpenRedirection.description: you can redirection on any page via /redirection/iha089-labs.in/<path>. exploit this to redirect user on any website.

HostHeaderOpenRedirection.description: an open redirection is present on /dashboard.html or profile.html route exploit it to redirect user on any website

DOMBasedOpenRedirection.description: an open redirection is present on /dashboard.html or profile.html exploit it to redirect user on any website

ParameterPollutionRedirection.description: an open redirection is present on /login exploit it to redirect user on any website
